nl_query_patterns.description: Balance sheet and trial balance queries
nl_query_patterns.business_context: IMPORTANT: XBILK (balance sheet indicator) is on SKA1, NOT on SKAT or SKB1. TXT50/TXT20 (account descriptions) are on SKAT. WAERS (currency) is on SKB1. Always use the correct table alias.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    g.RACCT AS gl_account,
    t.TXT50 AS account_description,
    t.TXT20 AS short_description,
    a.XBILK AS balance_sheet_indicator,
    g.DRCRK AS debit_credit_indicator,
    g.HSLVT AS opening_balance,
    COALESCE(g.HSL01, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL02, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL03, 0) + 
    COALESCE(g.HSL04, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL05, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL06, 0) + 
    COALESCE(g.HSL07, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL08, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL09, 0) + 
    COALESCE(g.HSL10, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL11, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL12, 0) AS period_activity,
    COALESCE(g.HSLVT, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL01, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL02, 0) + 
    COALESCE(g.HSL03, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL04, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL05, 0) + 
    COALESCE(g.HSL06, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL07, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL08, 0) + 
    COALESCE(g.HSL09, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL10, 0) + COALESCE(g.HSL11, 0) + 
    COALESCE(g.HSL12, 0) AS ending_balance,
    b.WAERS AS currency
FROM GLT0 g
JOIN SKA1 a ON g.RACCT = a.SAKNR
JOIN SKB1 b ON g.RACCT = b.SAKNR AND g.BUKRS = b.BUKRS
LEFT JOIN SKAT t ON a.KTOPL = t.KTOPL AND a.SAKNR = t.SAKNR AND t.SPRAS = 'E'
WHERE g.BUKRS = '1000'
  AND g.RLDNR = '00'
ORDER BY g.RACCT, g.DRCRK

nl_query_patterns.description: Employee headcount and turnover
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Employee listing with descriptive names for position, job, and org unit. PA0001 stores IDs (STELL=position, PLANS=job, ORGEH=org unit). HRP1000 stores the text descriptions. Join HRP1000 three times with different OTYPE filters: S for position, C for job, O for org unit. Always filter LANGU='E' for English text.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    p1.PERNR AS employee_number,
    p2.VORNA AS first_name,
    p2.NACHN AS last_name,
    pos.STEXT AS position,
    job.STEXT AS job,
    org.STEXT AS organizational_unit,
    p1.KOSTL AS cost_center,
    p1.WERKS AS plant,
    p1.BUKRS AS company_code
FROM PA0001 p1
JOIN PA0002 p2 ON p1.PERNR = p2.PERNR AND p2.ENDDA = '9999-12-31'
LEFT JOIN HRP1000 pos ON pos.OTYPE = 'S' AND pos.OBJID = p1.STELL AND pos.LANGU = 'E'
LEFT JOIN HRP1000 job ON job.OTYPE = 'C' AND job.OBJID = p1.PLANS AND job.LANGU = 'E'
LEFT JOIN HRP1000 org ON org.OTYPE = 'O' AND org.OBJID = p1.ORGEH AND org.LANGU = 'E'
WHERE p1.ENDDA = '9999-12-31'
ORDER BY p2.NACHN, p2.VORNA

nl_query_patterns.description: Payroll expenses by department
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Show me payroll by department
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure: SELECT department, SUM(salary) FROM HRPY_RGDIR JOIN PA0008 GROUP BY department

nl_query_patterns.description: Inventory on hand and valuation
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Show me inventory
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure: SELECT material, stock, value FROM MARD JOIN MARC JOIN MARA

nl_query_patterns.description: Detailed journal entry queries
nl_query_patterns.business_context: IMPORTANT: Currency (WAERS) is on BKPF (header), NOT on BSEG (line items). Always use h.WAERS from BKPF. Join BKPF (alias h) to BSEG (alias s) on BUKRS+BELNR+GJAHR.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    h.BELNR AS document_number,
    h.GJAHR AS fiscal_year,
    h.BUDAT AS posting_date,
    h.BLDAT AS document_date,
    h.BLART AS document_type,
    h.BKTXT AS header_text,
    h.WAERS AS currency,
    s.BUZEI AS line_item,
    s.BSCHL AS posting_key,
    s.HKONT AS gl_account,
    CASE WHEN s.SHKZG = 'S' THEN s.DMBTR ELSE 0 END AS debit_amount,
    CASE WHEN s.SHKZG = 'H' THEN s.DMBTR ELSE 0 END AS credit_amount,
    s.SGTXT AS line_text
FROM BKPF h
JOIN BSEG s ON h.BUKRS = s.BUKRS AND h.BELNR = s.BELNR AND h.GJAHR = s.GJAHR
WHERE h.BUKRS = '1000'
  AND s.HKONT = '0000400000'
ORDER BY h.BUDAT DESC, h.BELNR, s.BUZEI

nl_query_patterns.description: Order-to-cash process tracing
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Trace order to cash
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure: SELECT order FROM VBAK JOIN LIKP JOIN VBRK JOIN BSID

nl_query_patterns.description: Procure-to-pay process tracing
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Trace procure to pay
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure: SELECT po FROM EKKO JOIN EKBE JOIN RBKP JOIN BSIK

nl_query_patterns.description: List open maintenance orders with equipment and priority
nl_query_patterns.business_context: IW39N-style listing of maintenance orders
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT a.AUFNR, a.AUART, a.KTEXT, h.PRIOK, h.EQUNR, e.EQKTX AS equipment_desc, h.TPLNR, h.GSTRP, h.GLTRP
FROM AUFK a
JOIN AFIH h ON a.AUFNR = h.AUFNR
LEFT JOIN EQKT e ON h.EQUNR = e.EQUNR AND e.SPRAS = 'E'
WHERE a.AUTYP = '30' AND a.LOEKZ = ''
ORDER BY h.PRIOK, h.GLTRP

nl_query_patterns.description: Display orders and operations (IW49N equivalent)
nl_query_patterns.business_context: IW49N report showing orders with their operations, status, and work centers
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT a.AUFNR, a.KTEXT AS order_text, h.EQUNR, ek.EQKTX AS equipment_desc, h.PRIOK,
       v.VORNR AS operation, v.LTXA1 AS operation_text, v.ARBPL AS work_center, v.LOEKZ AS cancelled
FROM AUFK a
JOIN AFIH h ON a.AUFNR = h.AUFNR
JOIN AFKO k ON a.AUFNR = k.AUFNR
JOIN AFVC v ON k.AUFPL = v.AUFPL
LEFT JOIN EQKT ek ON h.EQUNR = ek.EQUNR AND ek.SPRAS = 'E'
WHERE a.AUTYP = '30'
ORDER BY a.AUFNR, v.VORNR

nl_query_patterns.description: Show cancelled operations from IW49N
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Filter IW49N for cancelled operations. Cancelled = AFVC.LOEKZ = 'X'
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT a.AUFNR, a.KTEXT, h.EQUNR, h.TPLNR,
       v.VORNR, v.LTXA1 AS operation_text, v.ARBPL AS work_center
FROM AUFK a
JOIN AFIH h ON a.AUFNR = h.AUFNR
JOIN AFKO k ON a.AUFNR = k.AUFNR
JOIN AFVC v ON k.AUFPL = v.AUFPL
WHERE v.LOEKZ = 'X'
ORDER BY a.AUFNR, v.VORNR

nl_query_patterns.description: Maintenance history for a piece of equipment
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Show all maintenance orders and confirmations for equipment
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT a.AUFNR, a.KTEXT, h.ILART, h.PRIOK,
       r.VORNR, r.BUDAT, r.ISMNW AS actual_hours, r.PERNR
FROM AUFK a
JOIN AFIH h ON a.AUFNR = h.AUFNR
LEFT JOIN AFRU r ON a.AUFNR = r.AUFNR AND r.STOKZ = ''
WHERE h.EQUNR = :equipment_number
ORDER BY a.ERDAT DESC

nl_query_patterns.pattern_name: Unpaid vendor invoices by vendor name
nl_query_patterns.description: Show open/unpaid vendor invoices filtered by vendor name, joining BSIK to LFA1 for name resolution
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Users often ask about unpaid invoices using the vendor's name rather than number. BSIK contains open vendor items but only stores LIFNR. Must join LFA1 to filter by NAME1.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    v.LIFNR AS vendor_number,
    v.NAME1 AS vendor_name,
    b.BELNR AS document_number,
    b.GJAHR AS fiscal_year,
    b.BUDAT AS posting_date,
    b.BLDAT AS document_date,
    b.ZFBDT AS due_date,
    CASE WHEN b.SHKZG = 'H' THEN -b.DMBTR ELSE b.DMBTR END AS amount,
    b.WAERS AS currency,
    b.SGTXT AS description
FROM BSIK b
JOIN LFA1 v ON b.LIFNR = v.LIFNR
WHERE UPPER(v.NAME1) LIKE '%ACME%'
ORDER BY b.BUDAT DESC

nl_query_patterns.description: Show purchase orders where total PO value exceeds a specified amount, with vendor details
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Users ask about high-value POs. EKPO.NETWR is always positive (no SHKZG needed). Join LFA1 for vendor names. Group by PO to sum line items.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    k.EBELN AS po_number,
    v.LIFNR AS vendor_number,
    v.NAME1 AS vendor_name,
    k.BEDAT AS po_date,
    k.WAERS AS currency,
    COUNT(p.EBELP) AS line_items,
    SUM(p.NETWR) AS total_po_value
FROM EKKO k
JOIN EKPO p ON k.EBELN = p.EBELN
JOIN LFA1 v ON k.LIFNR = v.LIFNR
WHERE k.LOEKZ = ''
  AND p.LOEKZ = ''
GROUP BY k.EBELN, v.LIFNR, v.NAME1, k.BEDAT, k.WAERS
HAVING SUM(p.NETWR) > 50000
ORDER BY total_po_value DESC

nl_query_patterns.description: Top N vendors ranked by total spend amount
nl_query_patterns.business_context: Combines open (BSIK) and cleared (BSAK) vendor items for total spend. Uses DMBTR with SHKZG sign conversion. Joins LFA1 for vendor names. Defaults to company code 1000 if not specified.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    v.LIFNR AS vendor_number,
    v.NAME1 AS vendor_name,
    SUM(CASE WHEN i.SHKZG = 'S' THEN i.DMBTR ELSE -i.DMBTR END) AS total_spend
FROM (
    SELECT BUKRS, LIFNR, SHKZG, DMBTR FROM BSIK WHERE BUKRS = '1000'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT BUKRS, LIFNR, SHKZG, DMBTR FROM BSAK WHERE BUKRS = '1000'
) i
JOIN LFA1 v ON i.LIFNR = v.LIFNR
GROUP BY v.LIFNR, v.NAME1
ORDER BY total_spend DESC
LIMIT 10

nl_query_patterns.description: Cost center actual versus planned spending comparison
nl_query_patterns.business_context: COSP stores external postings. WRTTP='04' for actual, WRTTP='01' for plan. WKG001-WKG012 are monthly amounts. OBJNR format 'KSkkkkkkkkk' where kkkkk is 10-char cost center. CSKS table has KTEXT for cost center name. Defaults to 2025, version 000. Use SUBSTR() not SUBSTRING() - this is SQLite!
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    SUBSTR(c.OBJNR, 7) AS cost_center,
    c.KSTAR AS cost_element,
    SUM(CASE WHEN c.WRTTP = '04' THEN COALESCE(c.WKG001,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG002,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG003,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG004,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG005,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG006,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG007,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG008,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG009,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG010,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG011,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG012,0) ELSE 0 END) AS actual_amount,
    SUM(CASE WHEN c.WRTTP = '01' THEN COALESCE(c.WKG001,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG002,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG003,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG004,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG005,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG006,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG007,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG008,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG009,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG010,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG011,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG012,0) ELSE 0 END) AS plan_amount
FROM COSP c
WHERE c.GJAHR = '2025'
  AND c.VERSN = '000'
GROUP BY SUBSTR(c.OBJNR, 7), c.KSTAR
ORDER BY cost_center, c.KSTAR

nl_query_patterns.description: Sales orders created in a specific time period
nl_query_patterns.business_context: VBAK.ERDAT is the creation date (YYYY-MM-DD ISO format). IMPORTANT: VBAK uses WAERK for currency (NOT WAERS). Join KNA1 for customer names. AUART is the order type.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    v.VBELN AS sales_order,
    v.ERDAT AS created_on,
    v.AUART AS order_type,
    v.KUNNR AS customer_number,
    k.NAME1 AS customer_name,
    v.NETWR AS order_value,
    v.WAERK AS currency
FROM VBAK v
JOIN KNA1 k ON v.KUNNR = k.KUNNR
WHERE v.ERDAT >= '2025-01-01' AND v.ERDAT <= '2025-03-31'
  AND v.LOEKZ = ''
ORDER BY v.ERDAT DESC

nl_query_patterns.description: Display Financial Document - joins BKPF, BSEG, SKAT for document header and line items with account descriptions
nl_query_patterns.business_context: SAP Transaction FB03: Display Financial Document - joins BKPF, BSEG, SKAT for document header and line items with account descriptions

nl_query_patterns.description: Vendor Line Items - UNION of BSAK (cleared) and BSIK (open) joined with LFA1 and T001
nl_query_patterns.business_context: SAP Transaction FBL1N: Vendor Line Items - UNION of BSAK (cleared) and BSIK (open) joined with LFA1 and T001

nl_query_patterns.description: GL Line Items - UNION of BSIS (open) and BSAS (cleared) GL line items
nl_query_patterns.business_context: SAP Transaction FBL3N: GL Line Items - UNION of BSIS (open) and BSAS (cleared) GL line items

nl_query_patterns.description: Customer Line Items - UNION of BSID (open) and BSAD (cleared) joined with KNA1
nl_query_patterns.business_context: SAP Transaction FBL5N: Customer Line Items - UNION of BSID (open) and BSAD (cleared) joined with KNA1

nl_query_patterns.description: Display Purchase Order - joins EKKO, EKPO, LFA1, MAKT, T001W, T001L, EKET, EKBE
nl_query_patterns.business_context: SAP Transaction ME23N: Display Purchase Order - joins EKKO, EKPO, LFA1, MAKT, T001W, T001L, EKET, EKBE

nl_query_patterns.description: PO by Material - joins EKKO, EKPO, MAKT, EKBE, LFA1
nl_query_patterns.business_context: SAP Transaction ME2M: PO by Material - joins EKKO, EKPO, MAKT, EKBE, LFA1

nl_query_patterns.description: Display Sales Order - joins VBAK, VBAP, VBPA, KNA1, MAKT
nl_query_patterns.business_context: SAP Transaction VA03: Display Sales Order - joins VBAK, VBAP, VBPA, KNA1, MAKT

nl_query_patterns.description: Display Billing Document - joins VBRK, VBRP
nl_query_patterns.business_context: SAP Transaction VF03: Display Billing Document - joins VBRK, VBRP

nl_query_patterns.description: Display Accounting Document (FB03) - full document header and line items with account descriptions
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for FB03 queries: Join BKPF (header) to BSEG (line items) on BUKRS+BELNR+GJAHR. For account descriptions join SKAT on KTOPL+SAKNR with SPRAS='E'. Use TXT20 for short description and TXT50 for long description. SKAT.KTOPL comes from SKA1 or default '1000'. If SKAT has no match, use COALESCE to show 'N/A'. Currency is ALWAYS from BKPF.WAERS, never BSEG.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    h.BELNR AS document_number,
    h.GJAHR AS fiscal_year,
    h.BUKRS AS company_code,
    h.BLART AS document_type,
    h.BLDAT AS document_date,
    h.BUDAT AS posting_date,
    h.BKTXT AS header_text,
    h.WAERS AS currency,
    s.BUZEI AS line_item,
    s.BSCHL AS posting_key,
    s.HKONT AS gl_account,
    COALESCE(t.TXT20, 'N/A') AS short_description,
    COALESCE(t.TXT50, 'N/A') AS account_description,
    CASE WHEN s.SHKZG = 'S' THEN s.DMBTR ELSE 0 END AS debit_amount,
    CASE WHEN s.SHKZG = 'H' THEN s.DMBTR ELSE 0 END AS credit_amount,
    s.SGTXT AS line_text
FROM BKPF h
JOIN BSEG s ON h.BUKRS = s.BUKRS AND h.BELNR = s.BELNR AND h.GJAHR = s.GJAHR
LEFT JOIN SKAT t ON t.SAKNR = s.HKONT AND t.SPRAS = 'E' AND t.KTOPL = '1000'
WHERE h.BELNR = '5100000001'
ORDER BY s.BUZEI

nl_query_patterns.description: GL Line Items (FBL3N) - detailed GL account line items with assignment field
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for FBL3N queries: Use BSIS for open GL items, BSAS for cleared. ZUONR is the assignment field - use COALESCE(ZUONR, '') to avoid NULLs. Join BKPF for document header text if needed. Key columns: BELNR, GJAHR, BUZEI, BUDAT, BLDAT, HKONT, DMBTR, SHKZG, ZUONR, SGTXT, XBLNR. Always include COALESCE for optional fields like ZUONR, SGTXT, XBLNR.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    gli.BELNR AS document_number,
    gli.GJAHR AS fiscal_year,
    gli.BUZEI AS line_item,
    gli.BUKRS AS company_code,
    gli.BUDAT AS posting_date,
    gli.BLDAT AS document_date,
    gli.HKONT AS gl_account,
    CASE WHEN gli.SHKZG = 'S' THEN gli.DMBTR ELSE -gli.DMBTR END AS amount,
    gli.WAERS AS currency,
    COALESCE(gli.ZUONR, '') AS assignment,
    COALESCE(gli.SGTXT, '') AS text,
    COALESCE(gli.XBLNR, '') AS reference
FROM (
    SELECT * FROM BSIS WHERE HKONT = '0000400000' AND BUKRS = '1000'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM BSAS WHERE HKONT = '0000400000' AND BUKRS = '1000'
) gli
ORDER BY gli.BUDAT DESC, gli.BELNR

nl_query_patterns.description: Cost center actual vs plan with cost center descriptions from CSKS
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL: For cost center actual vs plan, join CSKS to get cost center names via KTEXT. The join key is: CSKS.KOSTL = SUBSTR(COSP.OBJNR, 3) (strip 'KS' prefix from OBJNR). CSKS also has KOKRS (controlling area). COSP.WRTTP='04' for actual, '01' for plan. COSP.VERSN='000' for operative. Sum WKG001-WKG012 for yearly total. Always COALESCE the CSKS.KTEXT to handle missing descriptions.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    SUBSTR(c.OBJNR, 3) AS cost_center,
    COALESCE(cs.KTEXT, 'Unknown') AS cost_center_name,
    c.KSTAR AS cost_element,
    SUM(CASE WHEN c.WRTTP = '04' THEN COALESCE(c.WKG001,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG002,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG003,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG004,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG005,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG006,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG007,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG008,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG009,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG010,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG011,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG012,0) ELSE 0 END) AS actual_amount,
    SUM(CASE WHEN c.WRTTP = '01' THEN COALESCE(c.WKG001,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG002,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG003,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG004,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG005,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG006,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG007,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG008,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG009,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG010,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG011,0)+COALESCE(c.WKG012,0) ELSE 0 END) AS plan_amount
FROM COSP c
LEFT JOIN CSKS cs ON SUBSTR(c.OBJNR, 3) = cs.KOSTL
WHERE c.GJAHR = '2025' AND c.VERSN = '000'
GROUP BY SUBSTR(c.OBJNR, 3), COALESCE(cs.KTEXT, 'Unknown'), c.KSTAR
ORDER BY cost_center, c.KSTAR

nl_query_patterns.description: Cost Center Line Items (KSB1) - detailed postings to a cost center from COEP/COBK
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for KSB1 queries: COEP has cost center line items. OBJNR format for cost centers is 'KS' + controlling_area + cost_center (e.g., 'KS10000000001000'). When user says 'cost center 1000', search with OBJNR LIKE '%1000' or use SUBSTR. Join COBK for document header (BUDAT, BLDAT). Key columns: BELNR (doc number), BUZEI (line), GJAHR (year), KSTAR (cost element), WKG001-WKG012 or WKGBTR (total). Filter WRTTP='04' for actuals. If using WKGBTR it has the total amount. Alternatively sum WKG001-WKG012.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    c.BELNR AS document_number,
    c.BUZEI AS line_item,
    c.GJAHR AS fiscal_year,
    h.BUDAT AS posting_date,
    h.BLDAT AS document_date,
    SUBSTR(c.OBJNR, 3) AS cost_center,
    c.KSTAR AS cost_element,
    c.WKGBTR AS amount,
    c.WAERS AS currency,
    COALESCE(c.SGTXT, '') AS text
FROM COEP c
JOIN COBK h ON c.BELNR = h.BELNR AND c.GJAHR = h.GJAHR
WHERE c.OBJNR LIKE '%1000'
  AND c.WRTTP = '04'
  AND c.GJAHR = '2025'
ORDER BY h.BUDAT DESC, c.BELNR, c.BUZEI

nl_query_patterns.description: Internal Order Line Items (KOB1) - detailed postings to internal orders from COEP/COBK/AUFK
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for KOB1 queries: COEP has order line items. For internal orders, OBJNR format is 'OR' + order_number (e.g., 'OR000000100001'). Join AUFK for order master data (KTEXT description, AUART type, BUKRS company). Join COBK for posting dates. COEP.WRTTP='04' for actuals. Key columns: BELNR, BUZEI, KSTAR (cost element), WKGBTR (amount). Always include AUFK.KTEXT for the order description.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    a.AUFNR AS internal_order,
    a.AUART AS order_type,
    a.KTEXT AS order_description,
    a.BUKRS AS company_code,
    c.BELNR AS document_number,
    c.GJAHR AS fiscal_year,
    h.BUDAT AS posting_date,
    c.KSTAR AS cost_element,
    c.WKGBTR AS amount,
    c.WAERS AS currency
FROM AUFK a
JOIN COEP c ON c.OBJNR = 'OR' || a.AUFNR
JOIN COBK h ON c.BELNR = h.BELNR AND c.GJAHR = h.GJAHR
WHERE c.WRTTP = '04'
ORDER BY a.AUFNR, h.BUDAT DESC

nl_query_patterns.description: Display Purchase Order with GR History (ME23N) - PO header, items, schedule lines, and goods receipt history
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for ME23N queries: Join EKKO (PO header) to EKPO (PO items) on EBELN. Join LFA1 for vendor name on EKKO.LIFNR. Join MAKT for material description on EKPO.MATNR. LEFT JOIN EKBE for goods receipt history (VGABE='1' for GR). IMPORTANT: EKBE join is on EKBE.EBELN=EKPO.EBELN AND EKBE.EBELP=EKPO.EBELP. Do NOT reference EKBE.EBELN as e.EBELN if 'e' is used for another alias. Use distinct aliases: k for EKKO, p for EKPO, v for LFA1, m for MAKT, gr for EKBE.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    k.EBELN AS po_number,
    k.BSART AS po_type,
    k.BEDAT AS po_date,
    k.LIFNR AS vendor_number,
    v.NAME1 AS vendor_name,
    k.EKORG AS purchasing_org,
    k.WAERS AS currency,
    p.EBELP AS item_number,
    p.MATNR AS material_number,
    COALESCE(m.MAKTX, '') AS material_description,
    p.MENGE AS po_quantity,
    p.MEINS AS unit,
    p.NETPR AS net_price,
    p.NETWR AS net_value,
    gr.MENGE AS gr_quantity,
    gr.BUDAT AS gr_date,
    gr.BELNR AS gr_document
FROM EKKO k
JOIN EKPO p ON k.EBELN = p.EBELN
JOIN LFA1 v ON k.LIFNR = v.LIFNR
LEFT JOIN MAKT m ON p.MATNR = m.MATNR AND m.SPRAS = 'E'
LEFT JOIN EKBE gr ON p.EBELN = gr.EBELN AND p.EBELP = gr.EBELP AND gr.VGABE = '1'
WHERE k.LOEKZ = '' AND p.LOEKZ = ''
ORDER BY k.EBELN, p.EBELP

nl_query_patterns.description: Material Document List (MB51) - material movements with optional vendor/customer names
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for MB51 queries: MKPF is the material document header, MSEG is the line items. Join on MBLNR+MJAHR. LEFT JOIN LFA1 for vendor name (MSEG.LIFNR) and LEFT JOIN KNA1 for customer name (MSEG.KUNNR). Use COALESCE for vendor/customer names since most movements don't have both. MSEG.BWART is the movement type (101=GR, 103=GR reversal, 261=goods issue, etc.).
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    h.MBLNR AS material_document,
    h.BUDAT AS posting_date,
    h.USNAM AS user_name,
    s.BWART AS movement_type,
    s.MATNR AS material_number,
    COALESCE(m.MAKTX, '') AS material_description,
    s.WERKS AS plant,
    s.LGORT AS storage_location,
    s.MENGE AS quantity,
    s.MEINS AS unit,
    s.DMBTR AS amount,
    COALESCE(v.NAME1, '') AS vendor_name,
    COALESCE(k.NAME1, '') AS customer_name
FROM MKPF h
JOIN MSEG s ON h.MBLNR = s.MBLNR AND h.MJAHR = s.MJAHR
LEFT JOIN MAKT m ON s.MATNR = m.MATNR AND m.SPRAS = 'E'
LEFT JOIN LFA1 v ON s.LIFNR = v.LIFNR AND s.LIFNR != ''
LEFT JOIN KNA1 k ON s.KUNNR = k.KUNNR AND s.KUNNR != ''
WHERE s.WERKS = '1000'
ORDER BY h.BUDAT DESC, h.MBLNR

nl_query_patterns.description: Open Purchase Requisitions (ME5A) - PR items not yet fully converted to POs
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for ME5A queries: EBAN is the purchase requisition table. FRGKZ is release indicator (blank=not released, '2'=released). BANPR is processing status. LOEKZ is deletion flag. KOSTL (cost center) and AUFNR (order) may be NULL if not yet assigned - use COALESCE. Key columns: BANFN (PR number), BNFPO (item), BSART (doc type), MATNR (material), MENGE (quantity), PREIS (price), EKGRP (purchasing group).
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    e.BANFN AS requisition_number,
    e.BNFPO AS item_number,
    e.BADAT AS requisition_date,
    e.ERNAM AS created_by,
    e.BSART AS document_type,
    e.MATNR AS material_number,
    COALESCE(m.MAKTX, '') AS material_description,
    e.MENGE AS quantity,
    e.MEINS AS unit,
    e.PREIS AS estimated_price,
    e.WAERS AS currency,
    e.EKGRP AS purchasing_group,
    COALESCE(e.KOSTL, '') AS cost_center,
    COALESCE(e.AUFNR, '') AS order_number,
    e.FRGKZ AS release_indicator
FROM EBAN e
LEFT JOIN MAKT m ON e.MATNR = m.MATNR AND m.SPRAS = 'E'
WHERE e.LOEKZ = ''
ORDER BY e.BADAT DESC, e.BANFN, e.BNFPO

nl_query_patterns.description: Payroll results for all employees showing wage types and amounts
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL: When asked about payroll results, ALWAYS generate SQL immediately. Do NOT ask for clarification. Use PA0008 for basic pay data (wage types LGA01-LGA05, amounts BET01-BET05). Join PA0001 for org assignment and PA0002 for employee names. HRPY_RGDIR has payroll run directory. For a simple overview, PA0008 with PA0002 names is sufficient. Default to current records (ENDDA='9999-12-31').
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    p8.PERNR AS employee_number,
    p2.VORNA AS first_name,
    p2.NACHN AS last_name,
    p1.BUKRS AS company_code,
    p1.KOSTL AS cost_center,
    p8.TRFAR AS pay_scale_area,
    p8.TRFGB AS pay_scale_group,
    p8.TRFST AS pay_scale_level,
    p8.ANSAL AS annual_salary,
    p8.WAERS AS currency,
    p8.BEGDA AS valid_from,
    p8.ENDDA AS valid_to
FROM PA0008 p8
JOIN PA0002 p2 ON p8.PERNR = p2.PERNR AND p2.ENDDA = '9999-12-31'
JOIN PA0001 p1 ON p8.PERNR = p1.PERNR AND p1.ENDDA = '9999-12-31'
WHERE p8.ENDDA = '9999-12-31'
ORDER BY p2.NACHN, p2.VORNA

nl_query_patterns.description: Wage type totals summarized by cost center
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL: For wage type totals by cost center, join PA0008 (basic pay) with PA0001 (org assignment) to get KOSTL (cost center). Group by cost center and sum ANSAL (annual salary) or BET01 (primary wage amount). Join CSKS for cost center name. Default to current records (ENDDA='9999-12-31'). Do NOT ask for clarification.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure:
SELECT 
    p1.KOSTL AS cost_center,
    COALESCE(cs.KTEXT, 'Unknown') AS cost_center_name,
    COUNT(DISTINCT p8.PERNR) AS employee_count,
    SUM(p8.ANSAL) AS total_annual_salary,
    p8.WAERS AS currency
FROM PA0008 p8
JOIN PA0001 p1 ON p8.PERNR = p1.PERNR AND p1.ENDDA = '9999-12-31'
LEFT JOIN CSKS cs ON p1.KOSTL = cs.KOSTL
WHERE p8.ENDDA = '9999-12-31'
GROUP BY p1.KOSTL, COALESCE(cs.KTEXT, 'Unknown'), p8.WAERS
ORDER BY total_annual_salary DESC

nl_query_patterns.description: Maintenance Plans (IP03) - plan overview with scheduling details
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for IP03 queries: MPLA is the maintenance plan header with WARPL (plan number), WPTXT (description), MPTYP (plan type), FABKL (calendar). MPOS has maintenance items linked via WARPL. Keep query focused on MPLA core fields. Many PM detail fields (task lists, tolerances, etc.) are optional and will be NULL - this is normal. Include only essential columns to avoid NULLs: WARPL, WPTXT, MPTYP, STRAT (strategy), FABKL, AESSION (start date), HESSION (horizon).
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure: SELECT mp.WARPL AS maintenance_plan, mp.WPTXT AS plan_description, mp.MPTYP AS plan_type, COALESCE(mp.STRAT,'') AS strategy, mp.FABKL AS factory_calendar, COALESCE(mp.AESSION,'') AS start_date, COALESCE(mp.HESSION,'') AS horizon FROM MPLA mp WHERE mp.LOEKZ='' ORDER BY mp.WARPL

nl_query_patterns.description: Vendor Master Display (FK03)
nl_query_patterns.business_context: CRITICAL for FK03: LFA1 has ALL address fields (NAME1, STRAS, ORT01, PSTLZ, LAND1, REGIO, TELF1, TELFX). Use 'v' for LFA1. v.STRAS for street. Do NOT join ADRC. LEFT JOIN LFB1 for company, LFBK for bank. COALESCE all optional fields.
nl_query_patterns.example_sql_structure: SELECT v.LIFNR AS vendor_number, v.NAME1 AS vendor_name, v.STRAS AS street, v.ORT01 AS city, v.PSTLZ AS postal_code, v.LAND1 AS country, v.TELF1 AS telephone, COALESCE(b.ZTERM,'') AS payment_terms, COALESCE(bk.BANKL,'') AS bank_key, COALESCE(bk.BANKN,'') AS bank_account FROM LFA1 v LEFT JOIN LFB1 b ON v.LIFNR=b.LIFNR AND b.BUKRS='1000' LEFT JOIN LFBK bk ON v.LIFNR=bk.LIFNR ORDER BY v.LIFNR

sql_generation_guidelines.description:
CRITICAL: All generated SQL must be valid SQLite syntax. Key requirements:

1. Use SUBSTR(string, position) instead of SUBSTRING(string FROM position)
2. Use CAST(value AS type) for type conversions
3. String concatenation: use || operator, not CONCAT()
4. Date functions: use DATE(), not DATE_ADD() or similar
5. No CTE (WITH clauses) unless absolutely necessary
6. Table aliases required for joins
7. Test database uses ONLY these exact tables - do NOT reference tables like CSKT, T001L, etc. that don't exist
8. For Cost Center names, use CSKS.KTEXT directly (NOT CSKT)
9. For GL account descriptions, use SKA1.TXT50 (NOT SKAT which may not be loaded)
10. Always use exact existing table names from the semantic model

Common mistakes to avoid:
- SUBSTRING() instead of SUBSTR()
- Joining to non-existent tables (CSKT, SKAT, TCIOB, etc.)
- Using <> instead of != for inequality (both work but != is preferred)
- Not aliasing tables when joining
sql_generation_guidelines.example: CORRECT: SUBSTR(OBJNR, 7, 10) in SQLite. INCORRECT: SUBSTRING(OBJNR FROM 7). Also: Check table exists before joining. For cost center names, join CSKS directly, not CSKT.

sql_generation_guidelines.description: Different SAP modules use different currency column names. FI tables (BKPF, BSIK, BSAK, BSID, BSAD, SKB1) use WAERS. SD tables (VBAK, VBAP, VBRK, VBRP) use WAERK. MM tables (EKKO, EKPO) use WAERS. CRITICAL: BSEG does NOT have a WAERS column - to get currency for journal entries, join BKPF and use BKPF.WAERS. When joining BKPF (alias h) to BSEG (alias s), use h.WAERS for currency, never s.WAERS.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: FI journal entries: use h.WAERS from BKPF. SD sales orders: use v.WAERK from VBAK. MM purchase orders: use k.WAERS from EKKO.

sql_generation_guidelines.description:
CRITICAL RULE: When asked 'top vendors by spend' or similar, ALWAYS generate SQL immediately using BSIK + BSAK UNION. NEVER ask for clarification about which table or filter to use. The rule is:

1. Combine BSIK (open items) and BSAK (cleared items) using UNION ALL
2. Calculate total spend using SUM(CASE WHEN SHKZG='S' THEN DMBTR ELSE -DMBTR END)
3. Join to LFA1 for vendor names
4. Use company code 1000 as default
5. Group by LIFNR and NAME1, order by total_spend DESC
6. LIMIT 10 for top 10 vendors

Example: SELECT v.LIFNR, v.NAME1, SUM(CASE WHEN i.SHKZG='S' THEN i.DMBTR ELSE -i.DMBTR END) AS total_spend FROM (SELECT BUKRS, LIFNR, SHKZG, DMBTR FROM BSIK WHERE BUKRS='1000' UNION ALL SELECT BUKRS, LIFNR, SHKZG, DMBTR FROM BSAK WHERE BUKRS='1000') i JOIN LFA1 v ON i.LIFNR=v.LIFNR GROUP BY v.LIFNR, v.NAME1 ORDER BY total_spend DESC LIMIT 10
sql_generation_guidelines.example: SELECT v.LIFNR, v.NAME1, SUM(CASE WHEN i.SHKZG='S' THEN i.DMBTR ELSE -i.DMBTR END) AS total_spend FROM (SELECT BUKRS, LIFNR, SHKZG, DMBTR FROM BSIK UNION ALL SELECT BUKRS, LIFNR, SHKZG, DMBTR FROM BSAK) i JOIN LFA1 v ON i.LIFNR=v.LIFNR GROUP BY v.LIFNR, v.NAME1 ORDER BY total_spend DESC LIMIT 10

sql_generation_guidelines.description:
CRITICAL: When users ask common business questions without specifying filters, DO NOT ask for clarification. Generate SQL directly using sensible defaults:

- Company code (BUKRS): '1000' (default SAP company)
- Fiscal year (GJAHR): '2025' (current year)
- Currency: Use DMBTR (local currency) and WAERS for FI, WAERK for SD
- Ledger (RLDNR): '00' (operational ledger)
- CO version (VERSN): '000' (actual/operative)
- Account ranges: Common ranges like 400000 for specific queries

Examples where defaults apply:
1. 'Top vendors by spend' -> Use BSIK+BSAK, company 1000, no date filter needed
2. 'Q1 2025 sales orders' -> Use VBAK.ERDAT, dates 20250101-20250331
3. 'Cost center plan vs actual' -> Use COSP/COSS, GJAHR=2025, VERSN=000
4. 'Journal entries to account X' -> Use BKPF/BSEG, that account

Generating SQL with defaults is ALWAYS better than asking for clarification.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: User asks 'top 10 vendors by spend' -> generate SQL with WHERE BUKRS='1000', do not ask which company code

sql_generation_guidelines.description: SHKZG (Debit/Credit indicator) is S for Debit, H for Credit. Always apply sign based on SHKZG, as DMBTR is stored as positive
sql_generation_guidelines.example: CASE WHEN SHKZG='S' THEN DMBTR ELSE -DMBTR END AS signed_amount

sql_generation_guidelines.description: DMBTR is always in company local currency, WRBTR is in document currency. Use DMBTR for consolidated reporting
sql_generation_guidelines.example: Use DMBTR for financial statements, WRBTR for transaction audit trail

sql_generation_guidelines.description: Always filter by BUKRS (company code) for correct consolidation and security
sql_generation_guidelines.example: WHERE BUKRS IN ('1000', '1010')

sql_generation_guidelines.description: SAP dates are stored in YYYY-MM-DD ISO format in this database. Compare using BETWEEN or >= operators. Date functions like JULIANDAY() and DATE() work directly on these values.
BSIK contains open AP items (AUGDT is NULL), BSAK contains cleared items (AUGDT is populated). Use correct table based on requirement
sql_generation_guidelines.example: Open items: SELECT FROM BSIK WHERE AUGDT IS NULL; Cleared: SELECT FROM BSAK

sql_generation_guidelines.description: KOART field indicates account type: S=GL, D=Customer, K=Vendor, M=Material, A=Asset. Filter for specific account types as needed
sql_generation_guidelines.example: WHERE KOART='K' for vendor accounts

sql_generation_guidelines.description: GLT0 contains period balances HSL01-HSL16 (16 periods). Always specify which periods to sum for closing procedures
sql_generation_guidelines.example: HSL01+HSL02+HSL03+HSL04 = Q1 balance

sql_generation_guidelines.description: Cost centers have parent-child relationships via OBJNR in COSP. Use hierarchical queries for consolidation
sql_generation_guidelines.example: WITH RECURSIVE cc_tree AS ...

sql_generation_guidelines.description: MARD.LABST is valuated stock. Multiply by price to get inventory value. Watch for different price types (moving avg, standard, etc.)
sql_generation_guidelines.example: SUM(LABST * standard_price)

sql_generation_guidelines.description: Open items identified by NULL AUGDT (clearing date). Aging calculated as TODAY() - ZFBDT (due date)
sql_generation_guidelines.example: WHERE AUGDT IS NULL AND ZFBDT < CURRENT_DATE - 30

sql_generation_guidelines.description: GJAHR is fiscal year. Combine with period MONAT to identify posting period. MONAT can exceed 12 for special periods
sql_generation_guidelines.example: WHERE GJAHR=2024 AND MONAT BETWEEN 1 AND 12

sql_generation_guidelines.description: For multi-currency reporting, always use local currency (DMBTR) and convert using standard rates, not document rates
sql_generation_guidelines.example: SUM(DMBTR) for company consolidated; use rate tables for corporate consolidation

sql_generation_guidelines.description: BSEG.KOART identifies customer (D) vs vendor (K) line items. BSID for customers, BSIK for vendors
sql_generation_guidelines.example: WHERE KOART='K' for vendor items, use BSIK table

sql_generation_guidelines.description: PO quantity (EKPO.MENGE), GR quantity (EKBE with VGABE=1), Invoice quantity (RSEG.MENGE). Compare for discrepancies
sql_generation_guidelines.example: Match EKPO-EKBE-RSEG on EBELN and EBELP

sql_generation_guidelines.description: Use VBFA (document flow) table to link VBAK->LIKP->VBRK. VBFA.VBELV is prior, VBFA.VBELN is subsequent
sql_generation_guidelines.example: JOIN VBFA ON VBAK.VBELN=VBFA.VBELV AND LIKP.VBELN=VBFA.VBELN

sql_generation_guidelines.description: For PM orders: AUFK -> AFIH -> AFKO -> AFVC (operations) -> AFRU (confirmations). Join through AUFNR for order-level and AUFPL for operation-level
sql_generation_guidelines.example: AUFK.AUFNR = AFIH.AUFNR, AFKO.AUFPL = AFVC.AUFPL

sql_generation_guidelines.description: To find cancelled operations (IW49N), check AFVC.LOEKZ = 'X'. For reversed confirmations, check AFRU.STOKZ = 'X'
sql_generation_guidelines.example: WHERE AFVC.LOEKZ = 'X'

sql_generation_guidelines.description: Vendor invoice tables (BSIK, BSAK, RBKP, BSEG) store only the vendor number (LIFNR), not the vendor name. When a user references a vendor by name (e.g., 'Acme Corp'), you MUST join to LFA1 on LIFNR to resolve the name. Use LFA1.NAME1 for the vendor name. Apply the filter as: UPPER(v.NAME1) LIKE UPPER('%search_term%'). Similarly, always include LFA1.NAME1 in SELECT output for vendor-related queries so results are human-readable.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: SELECT b.*, v.NAME1 AS vendor_name FROM BSIK b JOIN LFA1 v ON b.LIFNR = v.LIFNR WHERE UPPER(v.NAME1) LIKE '%ACME%'

sql_generation_guidelines.description: Customer item tables (BSID, BSAD, BSEG) store only the customer number (KUNNR), not the customer name. When a user references a customer by name, you MUST join to KNA1 on KUNNR to resolve the name. Use KNA1.NAME1 for the customer name. Apply the filter as: UPPER(k.NAME1) LIKE UPPER('%search_term%'). Always include KNA1.NAME1 in SELECT output for customer-related queries.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: SELECT b.*, k.NAME1 AS customer_name FROM BSID b JOIN KNA1 k ON b.KUNNR = k.KUNNR WHERE UPPER(k.NAME1) LIKE '%GLOBAL%'

sql_generation_guidelines.guideline: SHKZG only applies to FI line item tables
sql_generation_guidelines.description: The SHKZG (debit/credit indicator) column exists ONLY on FI line item tables: BSIK, BSAK, BSID, BSAD, BSEG, and EKBE. Do NOT use SHKZG on MM tables (EKKO, EKPO, RSEG), SD tables (VBAK, VBAP, VBRK, VBRP), or any other tables. For purchase orders (EKPO), the NETWR column is always a positive net value — no sign conversion is needed. For sales orders (VBAP/VBAK), NETWR is also always positive.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: EKPO.NETWR is always positive. Do NOT write: CASE WHEN p.SHKZG = 'H' THEN -p.NETWR ELSE p.NETWR END. Simply use: p.NETWR

sql_generation_guidelines.description: To calculate total PO value, SUM the NETWR column from EKPO grouped by EBELN. EKPO.NETWR is the net value per line item in document currency. Do NOT apply SHKZG logic to PO amounts. Filter with EKPO.LOEKZ = '' to exclude deleted line items and EKKO.LOEKZ = '' to exclude deleted POs. Use EKPO.ELIKZ = '' for items not yet fully invoiced (open POs).
sql_generation_guidelines.example: SELECT k.EBELN, SUM(p.NETWR) AS total_value FROM EKKO k JOIN EKPO p ON k.EBELN = p.EBELN WHERE k.LOEKZ = '' AND p.LOEKZ = '' GROUP BY k.EBELN HAVING SUM(p.NETWR) > 50000

sql_generation_guidelines.description: For sales order totals, use VBAK.NETWR for header-level net value or SUM(VBAP.NETWR) for line-item totals. These are always positive values in document currency (WAERK). Do NOT apply SHKZG sign logic. Filter with VBAK.LOEKZ = '' and VBAP.LOEKZ = '' to exclude deleted items.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: SELECT v.VBELN, v.NETWR AS order_value FROM VBAK v WHERE v.LOEKZ = '' AND v.AUART IN ('OR', 'SO') ORDER BY v.NETWR DESC

sql_generation_guidelines.guideline: GL account master table column ownership
sql_generation_guidelines.description: The GL account master data is split across 3 tables. Columns are on SPECIFIC tables only — do not mix them up: SKA1 has XBILK (balance sheet indicator), KTOKS (account group), KTOPL (chart of accounts). SKAT has TXT20 (short text), TXT50 (long text), SPRAS (language). SKB1 has WAERS (currency), MITKZ (reconciliation account type), XOPVW (open item management). GLT0 has RACCT (account), BUKRS (company), GJAHR (year), RLDNR (ledger), DRCRK (debit/credit), HSLVT (carry forward), HSL01-HSL16 (period balances).
sql_generation_guidelines.example: XBILK is on SKA1 (use alias a.XBILK). TXT50 is on SKAT (use alias t.TXT50). WAERS is on SKB1 (use alias b.WAERS). Never reference s.XBILK or b.XBILK.

sql_generation_guidelines.description: CRITICAL: Before using any column, verify it exists on the specific table you are referencing. Related tables often have different columns. Common mistakes to avoid: XBILK is on SKA1 not SKAT/SKB1. SHKZG is only on BSIK/BSAK/BSID/BSAD/BSEG/EKBE, never on EKPO/EKKO/VBAK/VBAP. KOART is on BSIK/BSAK/BSID/BSAD/BSEG, not on BKPF. LIFNR is on LFA1/LFB1/EKKO/BSIK/BSAK/BSEG/RBKP, not on EKPO. KUNNR is on KNA1/KNB1/VBAK/BSID/BSAD/BSEG, not on VBAP. NAME1 is only on LFA1 (vendors) and KNA1 (customers), not on any transaction tables.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: Always check: which table has this column? Use the exact table alias for that table.

sql_generation_guidelines.guideline: HR position, job, and org unit descriptions via HRP1000
sql_generation_guidelines.description: PA0001 stores only IDs for position (STELL), job (PLANS), and org unit (ORGEH). To get human-readable descriptions, join to HRP1000 table three times with different OTYPE filters: OTYPE='S' for position text, OTYPE='C' for job text, OTYPE='O' for org unit text. Always filter HRP1000.LANGU='E' for English. Use LEFT JOIN since not all IDs may have descriptions. Use STEXT column for the short text description.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: LEFT JOIN HRP1000 pos ON pos.OTYPE='S' AND pos.OBJID=p1.STELL AND pos.LANGU='E' -- gives pos.STEXT as position description

sql_generation_guidelines.description: CRITICAL: Many SAP columns are optional and will be NULL in the database. Always use COALESCE() for fields that may not be populated: ZUONR (assignment), SGTXT (text), XBLNR (reference), KOSTL (cost center on requisitions), AUFNR (order number on requisitions), KTEXT (description text). Use COALESCE(column, '') for text fields and COALESCE(column, 0) for numeric fields. This prevents NULL values in query results.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: COALESCE(gli.ZUONR, '') AS assignment, COALESCE(e.KOSTL, '') AS cost_center, COALESCE(cs.KTEXT, 'Unknown') AS cost_center_name

sql_generation_guidelines.guideline: Payroll queries - never ask for clarification
sql_generation_guidelines.description: CRITICAL: When users ask about payroll results, wage types, or salary information, ALWAYS generate SQL immediately using PA0008 (basic pay) joined with PA0001 (org) and PA0002 (names). NEVER ask for clarification about which payroll period, area, or run. Use ENDDA='9999-12-31' for current records. PA0008.ANSAL is annual salary. PA0008.BET01-BET05 are wage type amounts. PA0001.KOSTL is cost center.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: SELECT p8.PERNR, p2.VORNA, p2.NACHN, p8.ANSAL FROM PA0008 p8 JOIN PA0002 p2 ON p8.PERNR=p2.PERNR AND p2.ENDDA='9999-12-31' WHERE p8.ENDDA='9999-12-31'

sql_generation_guidelines.guideline: Cost center OBJNR format in COEP and COSP
sql_generation_guidelines.description: In COEP and COSP tables, the OBJNR column encodes the cost center with a prefix. For cost centers, format is 'KS' followed by the controlling area and cost center number. When user asks for 'cost center 1000', filter with OBJNR LIKE '%1000' or use SUBSTR(OBJNR, 3) to extract the cost center portion. For internal orders, OBJNR format is 'OR' + order number. Always use SUBSTR(OBJNR, 3) in SELECT to display a clean cost center number.
sql_generation_guidelines.example: WHERE c.OBJNR LIKE '%1000' -- matches cost center 1000. SELECT SUBSTR(c.OBJNR, 3) AS cost_center

query_patterns.description: Total outstanding AP liability by vendor from open items
query_patterns.business_context: Shows how much is owed to each vendor based on open (uncleared) line items
query_patterns.example_prompt: What is our total outstanding AP liability by vendor?
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT b.LIFNR, l.NAME1, SUM(CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END) AS net_amount, b.WAERS FROM BSIK b LEFT JOIN LFA1 l ON b.LIFNR=l.LIFNR WHERE (b.AUGDT IS NULL OR b.AUGDT='') GROUP BY b.LIFNR, l.NAME1, b.WAERS ORDER BY net_amount DESC

query_patterns.description: AP aging bucket analysis using due date
query_patterns.business_context: Aging analysis of accounts payable open items in standard buckets
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show me the AP aging summary
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT b.LIFNR, SUM(CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END) AS total_outstanding, SUM(CASE WHEN julianday('now')-julianday(b.FAEDT) BETWEEN 0 AND 30 THEN CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END ELSE 0 END) AS current_0_30, SUM(CASE WHEN julianday('now')-julianday(b.FAEDT) BETWEEN 31 AND 60 THEN CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END ELSE 0 END) AS days_31_60, SUM(CASE WHEN julianday('now')-julianday(b.FAEDT) BETWEEN 61 AND 90 THEN CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END ELSE 0 END) AS days_61_90, SUM(CASE WHEN julianday('now')-julianday(b.FAEDT)>90 THEN CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END ELSE 0 END) AS over_90 FROM BSIK b WHERE (b.AUGDT IS NULL OR b.AUGDT='') GROUP BY b.LIFNR ORDER BY total_outstanding DESC

query_patterns.description: Summary of vendor payments from cleared AP items
query_patterns.business_context: Total payments made to vendors from cleared (paid) items
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show vendor payment totals this year
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT b.LIFNR, l.NAME1, SUM(CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END) AS total_paid, b.WAERS FROM BSAK b LEFT JOIN LFA1 l ON b.LIFNR=l.LIFNR WHERE b.GJAHR=strftime('%Y','now') GROUP BY b.LIFNR, l.NAME1, b.WAERS ORDER BY total_paid DESC

query_patterns.description: Outstanding AR balances by customer
query_patterns.business_context: Open receivables by customer showing what is owed to us
query_patterns.example_prompt: What are our outstanding receivables by customer?
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT b.KUNNR, k.NAME1, SUM(CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END) AS net_amount, b.WAERS FROM BSID b LEFT JOIN KNA1 k ON b.KUNNR=k.KUNNR WHERE (b.AUGDT IS NULL OR b.AUGDT='') GROUP BY b.KUNNR, k.NAME1, b.WAERS ORDER BY net_amount DESC

query_patterns.description: AR aging bucket analysis using due date
query_patterns.business_context: Aging of open customer receivables in standard buckets
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show me the AR aging report
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT b.KUNNR, SUM(CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END) AS total_outstanding, SUM(CASE WHEN julianday('now')-julianday(b.FAEDT) BETWEEN 0 AND 30 THEN CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END ELSE 0 END) AS current_0_30, SUM(CASE WHEN julianday('now')-julianday(b.FAEDT) BETWEEN 31 AND 60 THEN CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END ELSE 0 END) AS days_31_60, SUM(CASE WHEN julianday('now')-julianday(b.FAEDT)>60 THEN CASE WHEN b.SHKZG='S' THEN b.DMBTR ELSE -b.DMBTR END ELSE 0 END) AS over_60 FROM BSID b WHERE (b.AUGDT IS NULL OR b.AUGDT='') GROUP BY b.KUNNR ORDER BY total_outstanding DESC

query_patterns.description: GL trial balance showing debits and credits by account
query_patterns.business_context: Trial balance from GL totals table for a fiscal year
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show the trial balance for this year
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT g.RACCT, SUM(CASE WHEN g.DRCRK='S' THEN COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL01 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL02 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL03 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL04 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL05 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL06 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL07 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL08 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL09 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL10 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL11 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL12 AS REAL),0) ELSE 0 END) AS total_debit, SUM(CASE WHEN g.DRCRK='H' THEN COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL01 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL02 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL03 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL04 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL05 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL06 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL07 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL08 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL09 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL10 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL11 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(g.HSL12 AS REAL),0) ELSE 0 END) AS total_credit FROM GLT0 g WHERE g.GJAHR=strftime('%Y','now') AND g.RLDNR='00' GROUP BY g.RACCT ORDER BY g.RACCT

query_patterns.description: GL account balances by period for a specific fiscal year
query_patterns.business_context: Period-by-period GL balances with account descriptions
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show monthly GL balances for this year
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT g.RACCT, s.TXT50, CAST(g.HSL01 AS REAL) AS period_01, CAST(g.HSL02 AS REAL) AS period_02, CAST(g.HSL03 AS REAL) AS period_03, CAST(g.HSL04 AS REAL) AS period_04, CAST(g.HSL05 AS REAL) AS period_05, CAST(g.HSL06 AS REAL) AS period_06, CAST(g.HSL07 AS REAL) AS period_07, CAST(g.HSL08 AS REAL) AS period_08, CAST(g.HSL09 AS REAL) AS period_09, CAST(g.HSL10 AS REAL) AS period_10, CAST(g.HSL11 AS REAL) AS period_11, CAST(g.HSL12 AS REAL) AS period_12 FROM GLT0 g LEFT JOIN SKA1 s ON g.RACCT=s.SAKNR WHERE g.GJAHR=strftime('%Y','now') AND g.RLDNR='00' ORDER BY g.RACCT

query_patterns.description: Open purchase order summary with vendor and value
query_patterns.business_context: Active purchase orders showing total values by PO
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show all open purchase orders
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT e.EBELN, e.LIFNR, e.BEDAT, e.WAERS, e.STATU, SUM(CAST(p.NETWR AS REAL)) AS po_value FROM EKKO e JOIN EKPO p ON e.EBELN=p.EBELN WHERE (e.LOEKZ IS NULL OR e.LOEKZ='') AND (p.LOEKZ IS NULL OR p.LOEKZ='') AND e.STATU!='X' GROUP BY e.EBELN, e.LIFNR, e.BEDAT, e.WAERS, e.STATU ORDER BY po_value DESC

query_patterns.description: Open purchase requisitions not yet converted to POs
query_patterns.business_context: Outstanding purchase requests awaiting procurement action
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show me all open purchase requisitions
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT r.BANFN, r.BNFPO, r.MATNR, r.TXZ01, r.MENGE, r.MEINS, CAST(r.PREIS AS REAL)*CAST(r.MENGE AS REAL) AS est_value, r.ERNAM, r.BADAT FROM EBAN r WHERE (r.LOEKZ IS NULL OR r.LOEKZ='') AND (r.EBELN IS NULL OR r.EBELN='') ORDER BY est_value DESC

query_patterns.description: Material inventory valuation from material valuation table
query_patterns.business_context: Inventory values by material and plant using standard or moving avg price
query_patterns.example_prompt: What is our inventory valuation by material?
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT m.MATNR, m.BWKEY, CAST(m.LBKUM AS REAL) AS total_stock, CAST(m.VERPR AS REAL) AS moving_avg_price, CAST(m.STPRS AS REAL) AS standard_price, CAST(m.SALK3 AS REAL) AS total_value, m.VPRSV AS price_control FROM MBEW m WHERE CAST(m.LBKUM AS REAL)>0 ORDER BY CAST(m.SALK3 AS REAL) DESC

query_patterns.description: Revenue summary by customer from billing documents
query_patterns.business_context: Total billed revenue by customer
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show revenue by customer
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT v.KUNAG, SUM(CAST(p.NETWR AS REAL)) AS total_revenue, v.WAERK FROM VBRK v JOIN VBRP p ON v.VBELN=p.VBELN WHERE v.FKSTO='' OR v.FKSTO IS NULL GROUP BY v.KUNAG, v.WAERK ORDER BY total_revenue DESC

query_patterns.description: Open sales order backlog by order type
query_patterns.business_context: Unfulfilled sales orders representing future revenue
query_patterns.example_prompt: What is the sales order backlog?
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT v.AUART AS order_type, COUNT(*) AS order_count, SUM(CAST(v.NETWR AS REAL)) AS backlog_value, v.WAERK AS currency FROM VBAK v WHERE (v.LOEKZ IS NULL OR v.LOEKZ='') AND v.GBSTK!='C' GROUP BY v.AUART, v.WAERK ORDER BY backlog_value DESC

query_patterns.description: Delivery and shipping status from delivery documents
query_patterns.business_context: Shipping status showing deliveries and their line items
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show delivery/shipping status
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT h.VBELN, h.KUNNR, h.WADAT, h.WADAT_IST, COUNT(i.POSNR) AS line_count, SUM(CAST(i.LFIMG AS REAL)) AS total_qty, CASE WHEN h.WADAT_IST!='' AND h.WADAT_IST IS NOT NULL THEN 'Shipped' ELSE 'Pending' END AS status FROM LIKP h JOIN LIPS i ON h.VBELN=i.VBELN GROUP BY h.VBELN, h.KUNNR, h.WADAT, h.WADAT_IST ORDER BY h.WADAT DESC

query_patterns.description: Cost center actual spending from CO line items
query_patterns.business_context: Actual costs posted to cost centers by cost element
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show cost center actuals for this year
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT k.KOSTL, k.KTEXT, c.KSTAR, COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG001 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG002 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG003 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG004 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG005 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG006 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG007 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG008 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG009 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG010 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG011 AS REAL),0)+COALESCE(CAST(c.WKG012 AS REAL),0) AS annual_actual FROM COSS c JOIN CSKS k ON c.OBJNR='KS'||k.KOSTL AND c.KOKRS=k.KOKRS WHERE c.GJAHR=strftime('%Y','now') ORDER BY annual_actual DESC

query_patterns.description: Active employee headcount by organizational unit
query_patterns.business_context: Current headcount grouped by organizational assignment
query_patterns.example_prompt: What is our headcount by org unit?
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT p.WERKS, p.BTRTL, p.ORGEH, COUNT(DISTINCT p.PERNR) AS headcount FROM PA0001 p WHERE p.ENDDA>='9999-12-31' OR p.ENDDA>=date('now') GROUP BY p.WERKS, p.BTRTL, p.ORGEH ORDER BY headcount DESC

query_patterns.description: Total payroll costs by organizational unit
query_patterns.business_context: Aggregate compensation costs grouped by organization
query_patterns.example_prompt: What are our payroll costs by org unit?
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT o.WERKS, o.BTRTL, SUM(CAST(s.ANSAL AS REAL)) AS total_annual_salary, COUNT(DISTINCT s.PERNR) AS employee_count FROM PA0008 s JOIN PA0001 o ON s.PERNR=o.PERNR WHERE (s.ENDDA>='9999-12-31' OR s.ENDDA>=date('now')) AND (o.ENDDA>='9999-12-31' OR o.ENDDA>=date('now')) GROUP BY o.WERKS, o.BTRTL ORDER BY total_annual_salary DESC

query_patterns.description: Average salary by organizational unit
query_patterns.business_context: Average annual salary grouped by organization for compensation analysis
query_patterns.example_prompt: What is the average salary by department?
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT o.WERKS, o.BTRTL, AVG(CAST(s.ANSAL AS REAL)) AS avg_salary, MIN(CAST(s.ANSAL AS REAL)) AS min_salary, MAX(CAST(s.ANSAL AS REAL)) AS max_salary, COUNT(DISTINCT s.PERNR) AS employee_count FROM PA0008 s JOIN PA0001 o ON s.PERNR=o.PERNR WHERE (s.ENDDA>='9999-12-31' OR s.ENDDA>=date('now')) AND (o.ENDDA>='9999-12-31' OR o.ENDDA>=date('now')) GROUP BY o.WERKS, o.BTRTL ORDER BY avg_salary DESC

query_patterns.description: Benefits enrollment summary by plan type
query_patterns.business_context: Employee benefits enrollment counts by benefit plan
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show benefit enrollment summary
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT b.BPLAN, b.BOPTI, COUNT(DISTINCT b.PERNR) AS enrolled_count FROM PA0167 b WHERE b.ENDDA>='9999-12-31' OR b.ENDDA>=date('now') GROUP BY b.BPLAN, b.BOPTI ORDER BY enrolled_count DESC

query_patterns.description: Equipment master status and location
query_patterns.business_context: Equipment inventory with status and functional location
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show equipment status
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT e.EQUNR, e.EQKTX, e.TPLNR, e.SWERK, e.INBDT AS install_date, e.HERST AS manufacturer FROM EQUI e WHERE (e.LVORM IS NULL OR e.LVORM='') ORDER BY e.EQUNR

query_patterns.description: Maintenance order confirmations with hours and quantities
query_patterns.business_context: Actual labor hours and quantities confirmed against maintenance orders
query_patterns.example_prompt: Show maintenance order actuals
query_patterns.sql_template: SELECT a.AUFNR, SUM(CAST(a.ISMNW AS REAL)) AS total_hours, SUM(CAST(a.ISMNG AS REAL)) AS total_quantity, COUNT(DISTINCT a.VORNR) AS operation_count FROM AFRU a WHERE a.STOKZ='' GROUP BY a.AUFNR ORDER BY total_hours DESC
